website_summaries.verdict: While affordable and appealing to some users with specific needs, others will find them less durable and comprehensive than other options on our shortlist.
pros: A small set that comes with a convenient organizing case that's compact and easy to take on the go
Includes pieces that can be hard to find, including e-socket and torx bits
cons: Durability depends on the tasks they are used for – stubborn nuts and bolts have been known to result in broken bits

customer_reviews.title: They keep breaking
customer_reviews.text: I've now purchased two of these sets, and the security torx version of it as well. I also have Neiko's hex and long hex sets. Specifically with the torx sets, the bits keep breaking. I've broken 3 T40's (one from every set) on different bolts, and a T10 as well. I like the sets and the case but unfortunately I have to move on to something stronger, these just aren't usable if they're going to keep breaking when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hassler

customer_reviews.title: WILL NEVER BUY FROM NEIKO AGAIN. CRAP TOOLS!
customer_reviews.text: These torx bits suck ass. Used mabye once and the t-15 bit rung out. I will never buy from neiko again. I wouldn't of even gave it one star but i had to get this on here.You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: sajun

customer_reviews.title: Ok but will break under extreme pressure
customer_reviews.text: Nice affordable set; however, I broke my T47 today trying to remove a seat belt anchor. I'm rebuilding a 1983 CJ7 and I had to crank pretty hard on this seat belt anchor...unfortunately broke the bit. Absent this one, I've used the set regularly with no issues. If you have an older vehicle where the bolts may have never been removed, you may want to consider an impact torx set.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Broken bit upon first use -- left broken piece in ...
customer_reviews.text: Broken bit upon first use -- left broken piece in the bolt which was difficult to fish out and now a vehicle which was partially reassembled. Couldn't wait for a new shipment so ended up trucking down to the NAPA to get a different set .. do yourself a favor and get something stronger to start.
customer_reviews.author: Ser Acer

customer_reviews.title: Bits snapped first time using it on the motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: I am sure if you are using it for light work they will be fine, any bolts with loctite etc they’ll probably snap first time using it like my set did. Was so busy forgot to do a return on them. You do pay for what you get though. Lesson learned, the heads also don’t bite very tight into the torx head screws. Profile of the bit or something hard to explain but the kit is incomplete for me now. Good luck to those it works for.
customer_reviews.author: Trangarion

customer_reviews.title: Neiko makes nice tools
customer_reviews.text: I bought Neiko tools before and I like them, a lot. With Tekton they are my go to supplier. And all of that for a great price. I see no reason to get more expensive tools. These socket are nicely finished, fit well and hold up. The letters of the size labels are stamped in to the socket and are large. I use a sharpy once in a while to go over the lettering and then wipe it off to make the lettering stand out more. The box they come in are a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: These are more than adequate for your average joe but will probably not be good enough for a professional. The bits are a bit soft and mat easily, and the fit is not very precise. These bits are also quite a bit longer than they really need to be which makes it difficult to fit them in tight spots. They left me pretty underwhelmed but I am used to very high quality tools.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I used them. They look great but are too brittle
customer_reviews.author: N. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: These are not well-made tools
customer_reviews.text: Most folks won't need to use torx sockets very often, so this set is probably fine. I work on cars, and the tips of these tools are very soft. I distorted two of them within days of owning the set, which is not ideal. I would not purchase again or recommend to anyone that does anything beyond very light work.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great! Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set mainly because my T55 was broken and a couple other ones as well. I was a little apprehensive because of the reviews recently and the fact that I was going to need this to remove the bolts that hold the seat to the floor but it worked perfect. Even with a 1/2" ratchet for extra leverage it never bent or warped at all. Going in and out it fit great and was really smooth. Glad I bought this whole kit rather than replace my Snap-On one for twice the price for just 1 star bit.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of Torx bits
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set three years ago. It's great and I haven't broken any yet. Don't think that when one seems to fit, it's the right size. Always try the next bigger size because sometimes one size too small seems like it fits. This isn't a complaint about these in particular - it applies to torx bits in general. So if you always use the right size, you shouldn't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: JohnAndrews

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tools to work on my BMW. There are a lot of Torx fasteners on the car both in and out of the engine bay, so it's important to have a set of tools that you can rely on. Be fit and finish is very good, the Chrome work is very bright and the engraving showing the sizes is deep and easily readable. I would buy again no questions.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Economical price but quality bits
customer_reviews.text: For the economical cost of this set I figured these would be cheaply made. I only needed to use one of the bits for a door lock repair on my truck so if the bit only lasted long enough to get the lock out and back in again then I was pleased. Still much cheaper than the hundreds of dollars a shop would have charged me. I was very surprised when the bits arrived. They are hefty and worked very well on the repair I was doing.
customer_reviews.author: N.B.W.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage tools. Don't purchase if plan on using for anything serious. First time I used it the T30 bit broke. Unfortunately I'm 30 days outside the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ford

customer_reviews.title: Good set, could use a better case
customer_reviews.text: Good low cost set of Torx bits. My only complaint is the bits don't snap tightly into the case. First time I opened the case the bits went flying. I took 1 star off since I think the case should securely hold the bits so the stay in place when you are opening it.
customer_reviews.author: ZOIKS

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with these tamperproof torx plus bit sockets
customer_reviews.text: I am rebuilding a 1987 Jeep Wrangler. I needed take the roll bars off and found weird looking torx bolts. I had to remove the seatbelt hardware which also required the specialty bit. I went to Ace hardware who has everything. The sales guy was familiar with the tamper proof torx plus but they only had upto T-40. Not big enough. I did a search and found these. Professional quality at a harbor freight price. The case is a nice bonus too. I am very pleased with this product. Amazon prime shipping got them to me quickly
customer_reviews.author: Tommy two chins

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me, but I've not pounded them.
customer_reviews.text: I did not need anything fancy for my purposes. Harbor freight level items would work for me. I am a shade-tree car tinkerer. Work only on my car. Was taking out seats to do some sound proofing. So my 5-star review should only be taken to state that these worked to get the seat out (and back in combined with a torque wrench), they came in a timely fashion, they came clean (not covered in excessive oil/grease), the tolerances seem decent. I cannot say how long they would last. I have not hammered on them. I have not used them in extreme cases. They are certainly not Snap-On quality, but they worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive tools
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 VW Jetta and bought this socket set to allow me to do basic maintenance on my car as needed. I figured for the price I'd give it a chance and I've been well pleased so far. The sockets seem to be well made and the bits themselves are solid. I haven't noticed any cracking or bending so that's a good sign to me at this point. I would reccomend these
customer_reviews.author: Codie S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke too easy. ☹️
customer_reviews.text: They break in the tamper proof area too easy. I'm a full time mechanic so I know when a tool breaks to easy becaus it's once in a blue moon that I break a tool but these are the blue moons. I've had great success for over 5 years with the Nieko triple square bits although there non tamper proof type.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Charlie on YouTube.

customer_reviews.title: Theres something wrong with these. they strip out the bolt as if theyre a bit too small to fit snug
customer_reviews.text: Theres something wrong with these. they strip out the bolt on every crucial step on my 2012 GTI and. Its like theyre a tiny bit smaller than theyre supposed to be so they SEEM to get a good fit and as soon as you start torquing on them. they spin and strip the bolt. this has happened to me on 3 different sizes!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and well made
customer_reviews.text: High quality torx set, using them professionally as an auto tech, have used many other brands that either twist easily or break off, these are the best I have used, much more durable than the Carlisle set from Napa costing over $100, they are even holding up to impact use without deforming.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine E.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage quality: they twisted on first use
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage quality. They twisted on first use. I was using a torque wrench to ensure I wasn't securing the bolt too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Hooles

customer_reviews.title: Great Socket Set - Stood Up to Abuse
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these sockets. Used them to work on an older truck where corrosion and siezed bolts has been a problem. Although probably not recommended, I used these sockets on an impact and they took the torque (probably over 100 ft-lbs) with no issue. Also used them with a breaker bar, and there is no visible deformation or wear on the bits. Definitely happy with these for the price, and will be looking at more Neiko tools in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good tool at affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a while that I have been using this. It is good quality budget tool I am enjoying using. However, I realized yesterday that there are two T47s and one T40 is missing. Is it possible to get support to resolve this issue now?
customer_reviews.author: HimmelBlau

customer_reviews.title: Bit Broke first time
customer_reviews.text: Used for the first time and broke a bit. It was the 27. All I was doing was replacing a Derby cover on my Harley. Should never have broke. Did not even apply that much pressure. Will be updating if they replace it for me.
customer_reviews.author: k.swof

customer_reviews.title: ... now in my home garage and have been quite pleased. I have had no issues with the tools ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these bits for a while now in my home garage and have been quite pleased. I have had no issues with the tools breaking or rounding. I deducted one star because I have a set of Torx T-handles that seem to fit fasteners a little bit more snugly than these bits, which goes a long way to prevent stripping heads. It is, however, worth noting that those T-handles were MUCH more expensive.I have since purchased similar Neiko triple square (12 pt) and hex keys and also have no complaints. I am a sucker for tools that come in storage cases!
customer_reviews.author: Justin C. in TX

customer_reviews.title: Good bits, bad case
customer_reviews.text: The bits do NOT stay in the case, they fall out all over the place whenever the case is opened. I have had to play "pick up sticks" every time I open the case above the ground. That being said, these are pretty good bits.
customer_reviews.author: Your Avg. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works, happy.
customer_reviews.text: Big, sturdy bits. The most common bits in the automotive industry, in one package. Just what I needed! For smaller bits than T8, I have cheap screwdriver kits. Comes in plastic cheap case (not for industrial use; but good enough for occasional opening and closing).
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: T30 security bit broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this kit for many years just in case I would need it someday. Today was that day and it disappointed. Used the T30 bit with the 3/8 adapter and it snapped off after the second bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Sassan Karai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light duty work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to add to my bicycle tool kit. For bikes these work great. I am not sure how they would hold up in an automotive application, but for light duty work they are a great value and work great.
customer_reviews.author: zinalia martel

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great Value. This 13 piece set is a real value. I was going to but one Craftsman T 55 for almost the same cost of this set. So far I have only used the T 55 for removing my Ford Ranger cargo bed. Saving me big time to replace the fuel inlet pipe. I adapted the 3/8 drive T 55 socket to a 1'' drive ratchet. No problems. The set look and feel expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Randall D. Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to drive size chaging with torx size. Only downside is t30 being 1/4" which is ok most times but some t30 bolts are a bit too tight for 1/4" so i just bought 3/8 t30 and add to the set.
customer_reviews.author: Shaft

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: The T40 socket snapped on the first use; wasn't really applying very much torque to it either - should not have broken. It comes with a nice case and they look good but I think the quality is crap. Suggest you buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Tough bit.
customer_reviews.text: I really had little confidence in these parts, because the price is very reasonable. Disclaimer: I have only used the T-55 bit, which is a 3/8" drive. However, I hooked it to a 1/2" drive adapter onto an impact wrench and cranked on 4 frozen caliper bolts on my Chevy truck. Crank, squirt some break-free, crank on the pneumatic some more, then more penetrating oil. Eventually, they broke loose. I expected this bit would be torn up, so I inspected it carefully, and it looked fine. The flutes were straight, sharp. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: C.Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended and helped replace drive pulleys in my car.
customer_reviews.text: I used two of the Torx bits out of this to work on my BMW and I am pleased with the quality of them. Someone mentioned the bits breaking under strain but I had no malformation or failures when using these to remove and install pulleys. I used quite a bit of force and did not see anything beyond slight visual wear. This wear was not a deformation or failure but rather a scuffing type wear. The case holds the bits solidly in place and I'm happy with the value here.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Worst tool purchase ever . Can you imagine the bit getting twisted . How soft the tool can be to get twisted during first use ? Go figure . Totally unacceptable . Used a Husky bit to complete the job . Stay away from this tool if you can
customer_reviews.author: M P

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worthless waste of money. The smaller 5 or 6 sizes all twist like pretzels when they encounter the least little bit of torque. Talking about loosening here, not tightening.
customer_reviews.author: VetteBNA

customer_reviews.title: First screw the T8H shattered had to go get another ...
customer_reviews.text: First screw the T8H shattered had to go get another one from Harbor freight, that one worked. These aren't hardened
customer_reviews.author: ronn

customer_reviews.title: Really nice set, handy to toss in a tool bag ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice set, handy to toss in a tool bag if there's a chance you'll encounter torx. Only complaint is that they are wearing a bit faster than I'd hope. I am using them almost exclusively on older, rusty fasteners, but I didn't expect the tines of the bit to be ground down after a dozen or so uses. Still functional, still a great set for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Nice Torx
customer_reviews.text: Good value and great case for the set. I could see how the bits could shear if used with a strong impact drill but I only do light duty work with these. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: AMZMaster

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: These sockets are hard to find in local stores. I needed it to replace a chain on a swing set. Got the right size and it was just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Nieko Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is made with the same quality of other sets I have purchased. I have been very pleased with their products and have had no problems. I like having them in cases to keep everything organized. Would definitely recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily
customer_reviews.text: First time, I used a bit with a standard socket and it broke. Had to take the item to a shop to get it repaired. Not for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Leitmeyer

customer_reviews.title: The size assortment is excellent, especially for working on German cars - from ...
customer_reviews.text: Strong quality-to-value ratio with this set. The size assortment is excellent, especially for working on German cars - from T-8 on trim pieces to T-60 on the wheel bearing housings. Construction and materials all look to be fantastic for the price. I can't speak to long-term durability and strength for someone using them daily as a professional tech, but it's the perfect set for the glutton-for-punishment-DIY-mechanics-with-German-cars, like me.
customer_reviews.author: TDS

customer_reviews.title: Fine for light use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this set for six or seven months and used it occasionally. It seems decent, and my extentions fit them well, as do the heads of the sockets into the torx bolts. I did have one break at the tip while trying to remove a torx bolt. The bolt was not a tamper proof one, and I was able to grind down the socket tip beyond the hollow recess and continue with successful removal of the bolt. The bolt wasn't incredibly tight, so I was disappointed in the tool breakage. In all, this set is worth the price, but don't expect excellent results 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: foradrive

customer_reviews.title: The case makes it easy to make sure you have put all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a HD motorcycle and these fasteners are used all over the thing. This set is handy and strong, well made. The case makes it easy to make sure you have put all of the bits away.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Dang ford and your special screws But i fixed it myself. Ha! These work great and traditional drill and socket wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bit Set!
customer_reviews.text: This torx bit set is at such a great price and feels like great quality! I bought a set of torx bits from Tractor Supply not too long ago and they snapped or stripped in the first use! This bit set feels significantly stronger and the material feels durable. The case is also super convenient. One thing to not is for the smaller bits, you will need a 1/4 inch ratchet rather than a 3/8 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great set and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Really like this set of torx bits. They appear well made and robust, and include a very nice storage case. It would be nice if they were externally labelled so I could tell the difference at a glance between these and the matching allen set I also bought, but a sharpie resolved that issue. I really like that the bits don't "snap" into the case, as it makes it much easier to remove them. I have some tool sets where the tools are extremely hard to remove from the case to use. No problems here, but don't tip the set over of you'll have bits everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great value set!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to remove a security torx on my car. These work great for light duty work. If you think these will hold up to using something that requires a lot of tq find a better more expensive alternative meant for heavy duty work.
customer_reviews.author: Clinty123

customer_reviews.title: So far, all is good.
customer_reviews.text: I've used several of the torx tips with a conventional 1/4" drive socket. So far, no problems. The set seems to be well built, the plastic case seems durable, and the price is certainly attractive. Haven't used any bits on a locked up car engine screw head so can't address issues other people have had. For dismantling a European cooking range, the kit works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Angela B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Used them for my yukons front brakes chevy put torx on the guide pins only needed the bigger one but still useful to have
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: only needed one size and now have a whole set for about the same amount. The box keeps them together, and the tamper proof allows for uses on those type bolts as a bonus
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Assortment of Torx Bits
customer_reviews.text: The quality is high. Better than Craftsman. This kit includes 1/2" drive, 3/8" and 1/2" drive bits. Only the Torx 60 is 1/2" drive. The range is broad and covers most of what the shade tree mechanic will use.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl C. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: I used the t-50 socket in a Hilty 1/2 inch impact gun to loosen 4 torqued bolts on a hub assembly and it didn't break. I probably should have gotten the impact rated sockets but it looks like these will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: backofbeyond

customer_reviews.title: Complete torx driver set
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this set of torx drivers, my corvette has very many torx style bolts and screws, i was able to use this set in order to complete multiple repairs already, 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: z. zabinski

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.......
customer_reviews.text: I had no Torx sockets and bought a Jeep Wrangler, guess what, every bolt on the Jeep is Torx, so these were just what I needed. They're well made and work with any ratchet type wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Near-perfect bit set
customer_reviews.text: These are beautifully made and finished. The tips are precisely machined and fit fasteners with a satisfying solidness. The tamper-proof holes are cleanly drilled in the exact center of the tip. The chrome is shiny and durable. The case is solid and fits perfectly. Heavy use doesn't seem to phase them. They appear almost identical to the Blue-Point and Matco tools, but for 1/4 the price. Highly, highly recommended. I wish all Neiko tools were this good.
customer_reviews.author: rcb

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. A terrible set. Cost me time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. The T27 bit warped and twisted under the pressure of a small 1/4 socket with average to low torque. So disappointed. Stalled my whole project. Even saw similar warping starting on the larger bits.
customer_reviews.author: CGTinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Stripped Out First Use (Heavy Use)
customer_reviews.text: Might be ok for some light duty, but my set stripped out on my first use. I admit it was a lot of torque with a breaker bar, but would have expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Grey Mist

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me. I used one to change brakes on an old Durango and another to change hatch struts. They worked as expected
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Brown

customer_reviews.title: These bits fit the bolts tight.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the handy plastic box these torx bits came in. No more searching all over my tool box trying to find the wright bit. I am a diesel technician and the bits have performed great on the job. Think I'll buy a set for my home use.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Duncan

customer_reviews.title: It's about having the right bit.
customer_reviews.text: Has a great assortment of sizes. There's nothing like having a bit that fits EXACTLY for the fastener you're trying to turn, less risk of stripping. I got this kit as it cost just a little more than buying a single bit that I was trying to find to use on seat belt bolts. The metal seems to be pretty hard as the bit didn't round in use. And having the correct size didn't strip the bolt either.
customer_reviews.author: MAD Sage

customer_reviews.title: Best security bits
customer_reviews.text: The security part of the bit is very deep which I needed! Built very well and use it all the time now!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F

customer_reviews.title: Good value set
customer_reviews.text: Set is a decent quality. Used to remive and install seats with no issue. Makes finding torx bit much easier. Recommend for value.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a couple of these for a project and was pleasantly surprised by their quality Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Nice case to accompany the set with a foam pad ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I tried the set performing small engine maintenance and they performed as designed. Nice case to accompany the set with a foam pad not pictured to further protect the sockets. Will they last for years? In my case yes. If used daily I'm not sure but for a hobbyist or homeowner they are fine. There is no warranty like Craftsmen and they are manufactured in Taiwan.
customer_reviews.author: Islanders Man

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and worked perfect for removing my truck bed bolts. The case is also a plus as it is thin and easily accessible won't open
customer_reviews.author: BigPat36

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The T50 broke the first time I tried using it (by hand). I should have read reviews
customer_reviews.author: PHP Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for occasional use. Not sure if would hold up to daily use or abuse. Overall I think it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SamMc

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: So I have a metwrench set that is probably 20 years old and throughout all those years I was missing one piece and it so happened that while at junkyard trying to remove a rear sliding window on a ford ranger it was the very piece I needed arrrrrgh! So I got this and although not a metwrench part it solves the problem. Now I have a complete set. Only thing now is, will my brother lose something as he borrows it all the time. Please brother, get your own tool set!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P

customer_reviews.title: Horrid Quality
customer_reviews.text: Immediately started warping as I unbolted my first cam, first time using. Then second bolt on my second cam it shatters at the bit. Get better bits. Plain and simple. Here's your proof
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Michael Morales

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works! Good all around set. Seems like other had quality issues but it (t50) held up against a 1/2 inch impact removing a 15 mm frozen bolt on the other side. I don't see myself using the set much, but it comes in handy when you need it!
customer_reviews.author: Make It Well, Make It Last

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality. I m a Happy Torx Bit Set Customer
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems to be good. I bought this to remove the hard cover off my jeep wrangler. I only needed 2 sizes but for the price I just bought the whole set. Why not? I am sure I will run across other uses for it over time. I am happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gambrell

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and great price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the price point. Most recent use was when changing the valve cover on my 2002 BMW. Worked like a champ. No chipping of teeth and fit nice and tight into socket even when using an adapter. Would buy again but plan to take care of these.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: Quality for very cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Great bits. Held up great when torque back on parts. Would buy again with no hesitation
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: It's so worth the money, it's made of tough material and case it comes with can withstand dropping...
customer_reviews.author: Al Smith

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without the proper torx bits? ...
customer_reviews.text: How did I live without the proper torx bits? For the price it saves your fasteners instead of using crude methods. Must buy for any mechanic. The case is solid and takes some abuse in my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Some random dude

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE! Use them to take the top off my 1989 K5 GMC Jimmy Blazer
customer_reviews.text: Needed these to get the top screws off. Great quality, LOVE the case. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: AhoyHoy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very useful, durable, high quality, reasonable price... what's not to LOVE about it?!? Buy it. Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Another dissatisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use these and the first time I've ever used one of the 1/4 drive ones in the set it snapped. I removed the same screw easily with a torx screw driver. I didn't realize it was no warranty. Junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: ScubaScott

customer_reviews.title: Torx Bit Socket Set, T8 - T60, S2 Steel | 13-Piece Set
customer_reviews.text: Now a days, when you look under the hood of a car, you'll find torque screws that require special tips for removal and installation. This set, with a sturdy plastic storage case, will meet most needs, for the variety of different torque tips, you will encounter.
customer_reviews.author: DJE

customer_reviews.title: its great quality set
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar set of these in 2010, it was the master set, I still have them and their still going strong, its great quality set.. this set was bought for work.
customer_reviews.author: Durston

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Torx bits are not the tool I use every day. But when you run across something that requires them, this is the product I wanted in my tool chest. It keeps all my 3/8ths drive torx together. It makes it easy to find in the bright blue molded shell case. You can buy cheapo torx bits, but they may just round out the stars so you have to drill and mess around to get the damaged screw out. Better to have the right size in a quality steel bit. At this price, it was an easy choice.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Nail

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a single use
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to use only 1 of the torx sockets. I had to change the struts that assist in the raising and lowering of the lift gate on our mini-van, and the bolts for these were hard to "break" loose. I only had a couple of Torx bits, and knew I needed something stronger. This bit had no problems with it. And shortly after the initial use when I thought this set was just going to sit around with my other tools, I actually found a 2nd and 3rd use. Price and delivery were great. Excellent addition to my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Nye Jr.

customer_reviews.title: a want more than a need
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to use these, so only time will tell. That said, they look to be of good quality and the case is nice for those of you that do not have/utilize rail storage.
customer_reviews.author: SLG

customer_reviews.title: Although probably not recommended, I have used these with my little cordless ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set after frustratingly having to drive to the parts store to buy a torx bit halfway through a project and it has come in handy several times since then allowing me to avoid similarly frustrating trips and saving time. Although probably not recommended, I have used these with my little cordless impact without breaking any or stripping out the end of one.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: High quality set and great value.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed, this is a high quality set. What I like the most is they use a standard square socket so I can use them with my torque wrench for a few applications where I need to torque using T bits.
customer_reviews.author: Review dude

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised of the quality for what I paid. Would recommend these for anyone need of set of Torx sockets as they are everywhere in new cars
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted and in a nice plastic case
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and in a nice plastic case. It has foam inside the top of the lid to keep them in place. I bent the side door lock on my enclosed trailer and needed tamper proof bits to take the bent one off and put the new one on.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: good set
customer_reviews.text: mechanic for last 20 yrs good set good quality. been using them for the last year no issues.
customer_reviews.author: marks

customer_reviews.title: but it looks like what was advertised and appears to be well built ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but it looks like what was advertised and appears to be well built and does fit my 3/8th sockets. However if you don't have a quarter inch drive socket you might want to order one also for the smaller sizes. I bought one after purchase at Home Depot. FYI I am a Harley MC owner and not a mechanic and these should work just fine for the service I intend to do. Bob, Lakewood NJ
customer_reviews.author: Robert Buys

customer_reviews.title: ratchet sizes
customer_reviews.text: Just so you know before you buy, you will need 1/4", 3/8" and 3/4" ratchet wrenches to use the different sizes of bits. Good product and the plastic case is great to keep everything together. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: john f. schultz

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of Torx sockets.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made set. I haven't actually had an occaision to use yet but very satisfied with the tools and the sturdy case they are in. Based soley on the looks I feel these will last me for a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: They seem like good quality sockets. Vendor provided fast delivery at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: ronald j. hax

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Well made and low cost. Work great with standard hand wrenches. No broken bits.
customer_reviews.author: 乇乂丅尺卂丅卄工匚匚

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for automotive work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit for work on my VW. Worked perfectly and a great addition to my toolset
customer_reviews.author: Lego

customer_reviews.title: These sets from Neiko are great. I have a Picquick for when I need ...
customer_reviews.text: These sets from Neiko are great. I have a Picquick for when I need more torque or a smaller diameter clearance, but sometimes you just need these on a ratchet to not take ages
customer_reviews.author: Shika

customer_reviews.title: For this price Yes!
customer_reviews.text: pretty solid set. I use these all the time. I would recommend these for sure!
customer_reviews.author: P. harty

customer_reviews.title: Quality tools
customer_reviews.text: It’s a higher quality product than I expected. Nice case. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

product_meta.title: Neiko 10071A Torx Bit Socket Set, Metric, T8-T60 | 13-Piece Set, S2 and Cr-V Steel, 1/4”, 3/8” and 1/2-Inch Drive
product_meta.description: Style:StandardA high quality 13 piece Torx Bit Socket and E-Socket Set. This Torx set features with heavy duty construction. Chrome Plated and Mirror Polished. 1/4-Inch drive: T8, T10, T15, T20, T25, T27, T30 x L 37mm. 3/8-Inch drive: T40, T45, T47, T50, T55 x L48mm. 1/2-Inch drive: T60.
feature_bullets: DURABILITY: bits made of premium S2 alloy steel for superior hardness that reduce wear-outs and insure longevity
TORQUE STRENGTH: high strength chrome vanadium steel sockets provide superior torque for greater turning power with mirror chrome finish for corrosion resistance
PRECISION BITS: precisely and automatically machined bit tips to ensure accurate size, chamfered bit ends insert smoothly into fasteners and protect both bits and fasteners from damaged edges
ORGANIZED STORAGE: set includes a sturdy plastic organizing case for secure storage and easy carrying
DURABILITY: bits made of premium S2 alloy steel for superior hardness that reduce wear-outs and insure longevity
TORQUE STRENGTH: high strength chrome vanadium steel sockets provide superior torque for greater turning power with mirror chrome finish for corrosion resistance
PRECISION BITS: precisely and automatically machined bit tips to ensure accurate size, chamfered bit ends insert smoothly into fasteners and protect both bits and fasteners from damaged edges
ORGANIZED STORAGE: set includes a sturdy plastic organizing case for secure storage and easy carrying
13-Piece Torx star bit socket set includes: 1/4” Drive: T8, T10, T15, T20, T25, T27, T30; 3/8” Drive: T40, T45, T47, T50, T55; 1/2” Drive: T60
